thread.title: Boracay police join search for QC road rage suspect
thread.title_full: Boracay police join search for QC road rage suspect

title: Boracay police join search for QC road rage suspect
text:
Boracay police join search for QC road rage suspect By AJ Bolando   11:06am Michael Mendoza gestures as he tells Chief Superintendent Guillermo Eleazar during a press conference at Camp Karingal how he saw road rage suspect Fredison Atienza (inset) allegedly shoot his brother, Anthony, in the back of the head last Saturday. BOY SANTOS 
MANILA, Philippines – The authorities are now searching the island of Boracay for the suspect in the road rage killing of an information technology professional last Saturday. 
Chief Superintendent Guillermo Eleazar, Quezon City Police District director, said on Thursday that high-stakes poker player Fredison Atienza, alias Sonson, flew to Boracay a day after he allegedly shot dead Anthony Mendoza, 27. 
Reports said Atienza had a flight back to Manila Wednesday but did not return since manhunt operation have been launched against him. 
In a radio interview, Senior Inspector Jess Baylon, Malay,Aklan police chief, confirmed to dzBB that Atienza is still in Boracay.   
Baylon said they have already coordinated with the QCPD and with aviation police to apprehend Atienza. 
“Sa ating information ay paikot-ikot lang siya (Atienza) dito at parati naman daw siya rito kahit before pa,” Baylon said. 
READ: IT professional killed in QC road rage 
Atienza allegedly shot Mendoza after an altercation at the intersection of Quezon and D. Tuazon Avenues in Quezon City. 
The incident was witnessed by Mendoza’s brother who was just behind them when the confrontation and killing happened. Anthony Mendoza (inset) lies dead along Quezon Avenue in Quezon City. Photos were taken from a Facebook post by Erwin Ilao.
